sentences.en: " For no life is more insincere than that lived as a masquerade. "
sentences.cn: 因为我的生活将不再像化妆舞会一样虚假.
空洞的诺言是无诚意的.

sentences.en: an offer which she knew to be impractical and insincere
sentences.cn: 一个她认为不实际、不真诚的建议

sentences.en: At worst, they are perceived as insincere or dishonest.
sentences.cn: 最坏的时候, 他们会被看成是言不由衷或不诚实.

sentences.en: Clyde , of course , was insincere in regard to all his overtures at this time.
sentences.cn: 克莱德提出这类主意的时候, 自然根本不是真心的.

sentences.en: He is above the insincere flattery.
sentences.cn: 他对这种假惺惺的谄谀不屑一顾.

sentences.en: He is insincere; I soon rumbled him.
sentences.cn: 他不真诚; 我不久便看穿了他.

sentences.en: Her words rang hollow , ie What she said sounded insincere.
sentences.cn: 她的话听起来很虚(言不由衷).

sentences.en: How long will I endure the insincere prayers of your spineless subjects?
sentences.cn: 我究竟还要忍耐多久你这种虚情假意的祷告?

sentences.en: It's less characteristic than your comment on it which is perfectly insincere.
sentences.cn: 这句注脚更富有你的特色,那就是毫无诚意.

sentences.en: John found himself surrounded by insincere flattery.
sentences.cn: 约翰发现自己为虚情假意的奉承阿谀所包围。

sentences.en: None of us like him because he is insincere.
sentences.cn: 他总是假模假式的,我们都不喜欢他.
西尔维娅的微笑很做作.

sentences.en: Some people are so terribly insincere you can never tell if they are telling the truth.
sentences.cn: 有些人非常虚伪，你根本说不准他们是否在讲实话。

sentences.en: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
sentences.cn: 生活中最使人筋疲力尽的事是装虚作假.

sentences.en: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere. ( A . M. Lindbergh )
sentences.cn: 生活中最使人筋疲力尽的事是弄虚作假. ( 林德伯格 )

trans.tran_en: pretending to be pleased, sympathetic etc, especially by saying nice things, but not really meaning what you say
